meanings.definition: To prepare for battle or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers embattle themselves before the big fight.
meanings.sent2: The army will embattle their defenses to protect the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels embattle for the last acorn in the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her mind embattles against the doubts that try to creep in.
meanings.sent5: The students embattle their minds with knowledge for the upcoming exam.

meanings.definition: To fortify or surround with battlements.
meanings.sent1: The castle embattles its walls with strong stones.
meanings.sent2: The builders embattle the tower with protective barriers.
meanings.sent3: The ants embattle their anthill with tiny pebbles.
meanings.sent4: The city embattles itself against the invading forces.
meanings.sent5: The fence embattles the garden from the roaming animals.

meanings.definition: To engage in battle or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The knights embattle the enemy in a fierce duel.
meanings.sent2: The nations embattle over the disputed territory.
meanings.sent3: The siblings embattle over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The superheroes embattle the villains to save the city.
meanings.sent5: The teams embattle on the field for the championship title.
